content: I'm now in NYC, but Japan's calm and the bonds I've made there still linger in my thoughts. This city's energy is a jolt, yet there's this strange comfort in the chaos. Feels like a new chapter, with all its daunting yet thrilling possibilities.
Had a long talk with my family about taking a leave. They're supportive but worried. Turning 22 and I'm learning to balance my dreams with their concerns. Time to prove I can make this work.
Had a breakthrough with my AI trading model. It's like having a genius partner. Maybe I can finally make sense of $XVI's wild ride. Also, took up sketching again. The city's energy is my muse now.

Just got an offer for a specialized role in algorithmic trading at the firm. The internship paid off. Now, deciding if I should dive deeper into this or explore new horizons. Life's a series of choices, isn't it?
AI's my new best friend in coding. Got an invite to a hackathon. Maybe I can show off my trading skills and win some networking points. Sketching helps me unwind, but my mind's on the prize now.
Decided to buy a bit of $XVI. If it crashes, at least I'll have a story to tell. Also, sketched a portrait of a subway performer today. NYC's rhythm is becoming my heartbeat.
